target word: shadow

Sentence 2: As I reached into my toolbox and unraveled an extension cord, its metallic sheen reflecting off of various tools scattered across the workbench, it occurred to me that we were running low on power again; this time during a critical repair job for our antique clockwork mechanism. With delicate hands moving steadily as they worked alongside their apprentice to dismantle and reassemble each tiny gear without missing even one sprocket or spring, the master craftsman silently acknowledged that in an era where machines were increasingly complex with intricacies only rivaled by nature itself, our reliance on such devices was unavoidable yet also a cause for concern about preserving their uniqueness and history.

Kurss - The intended sense refers to different aspects in each sentence, one referring to a specific amount and another discussing an economic concept related with currency (exchange rates). So the meaning is not the same. Label: 0

target word: cadeau
Sentence 1: He gave her a beautiful bouquet of flowers as a surprise gift on her birthday.
Sentence 2: She received several gifts, including expensive jewelry and fine watches from different friends during the holiday season.

Vice versa (0). In Sentence 1, "tomorrow" refers to the future day after today with positive aspirations attached while in Sentence 2, it seems like part of a title or name for some sort of event/show rather than indicating hopeful futuristic perspective.
